item.title: 1 D3 Overview
item.description: #codecademy-d3 D3 stands for Data-Driven Documents and has risen to popularity due to various reasons: D3 has revolutionised the way that data visualisation is built natively on the web.

item.title: 2 D3 Selection
item.description: #codecademy-d3 D3 works by ‘injecting’ data visualisations onto an object’s [[Document Object Model]], and associates data with a set of DOM elements.

item.title: 3 D3 Data-Element Relationship
item.description: #codecademy-d3 With elements [[2 D3 Selection|selected]], we can now associate data per element. You do this with .data() which takes an array of any type and binds its elements to the selected objects returned by .

item.title: 4 D3 The d Parameter
item.description: #codecademy-d3 After we’ve [[2 D3 Selection|selected]] our elements and [[3 D3 Data-Element Relationship|bound]] our dataset to them, we’ll need to find a way to properly display that data in those elements.

item.title: Document Object Model
item.description: The Document Object Model (DOM) is the data representation of the objects that comprise the structure and content of a document on the web.
